sections.title: Section C: Health Facility Microscopy Readiness

subSections.title: C.1 Staffing Levels

inputRows.label: 1.Is this facility a PHCU,DISPENSARY, PRIVATE CLINIC,FBO CLINIC
If yes:Are there at least two (2) Laboratory Technician available at this lab?
2.Is this facility a DISTRICT HOSPITAL,COTTAGE, MILITARY?
If yes:Are there at least four(4) Laboratory Technicians available at this lab?
Is this facility a REFERAL HOSPITAL ?
If yes:Are there at least ten (10)Laboratory Techinician available at this lab?

subSections.instruction: Instructions:Determine the number of staff members present on the day of the visit for the facility depending on its level.Note:Minimum staffing level:PHCU,Dispensary,Private Clinic,FBO Clinic-2 Lab personnel;Minimum staffing level:District Hospital,PHCC/Cottage,Military -4 Lab personnel;Minimum staffing level:Referral Hospital-10 Lab personnel.

Number of lab Technician trained on malaria microscopy

SECTION C :Health Facility Microscope Readiness Score

subSections.instruction: Check the following information system tools

subSections.title: D.1 Specimen Collection

inputRows.label: Arrange the required materials for slide sample collection
Is the label slide sample correctly using appropriate labels?
Collect blood sample by finger prick
Register patient ID number and date?
Prepare a thick and thin smear on a clean slide

subSections.instruction: Instructions: Observe the microscopist performing blood slide that is sample collection, fixation, staining, examination, and interpretation. If a facility has more than one microscopists observations should be made to different microscopists.If there is only one microscopist then all observations should be done on that microscopist. If there is no patient for observation, simulation can be done. Did Microscopist do the following?

subSections.title: D.2 Fixation and Staining of Blood Films

inputRows.label: Does this facility use a Giemsa?
Did the health provider do the following?
For thin blood smear fixes by spraying methanol for 1 second?
For thin blood smear, dries fixed slide smear in the air for 10 minutes before staining?
Prepares buffered water and Giemsa stain solution (working condition)?
Floods each slide and stain for the appropriate time (10 min. Count after flood 1st slide)?
Gently washes the slide starting with the 1st flooded slide?
Keeps the slide in the rack to air-dry?
Fixation and Staining of Blood Films observation sub score
SUB-SCORE: D.2 Fixation and Staining of Blood Films

subSections.instruction: Observe the microscopist performing blood slide that is sample collection, fixation, staining, examination and interpretation. If a facility has more than one microscopist observations should be made to different microscopists. If there is only one microscopist then all observations should be done on that microscopist. If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used. Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.3 Preparation of Stain

inputRows.label: Giemsa stain stock solution labeled with opening date and time
Giemsa stain stock solution kept well-stoppered in dark place
the pH of buffer used for dilution is 7.2.
Diluted Giemsa discarded immediately after use
Preparation of Stain observation sub score

subSections.instruction: If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used. Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.4 Slide Staining

inputRows.label: Slides are clean and not scratched.
Slide drained and dried on the rack or Slide warm
No heating used to dry films

subSections.instruction: If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used. Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.5 Slide Examination

inputRows.label: Immersion oil placed on a slide
Stage of microscope racked down before placing the slide
Focus with x40 objective before focus with x100 oil immersion objective

subSections.instruction: If there is no patient for observation, stored blood sample in the lab can be used. Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.6 Slide Reading

inputRows.label: Negative result differentiated from a positive result
If negative:  200 fields examined before declaring slide negative
If positive:   Parasite density quantified >10 by counting 200+ white blood cells
If the number of parasites is <10 after counting 200 WBC then continue to count up to 500+ WBC
Parasites reported according to species level

subSections.instruction: Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.7 Result Reporting

inputRows.label: Result reported as negative, where appropriate
If positive, parasite density reported as the number of parasites per microlitre of blood and malaria parasites species
Date and time of result recorded
Turnaround time of slide preparation and reading met (1 hour)
Result filled on the patient health record book and recorded in the laboratory register

subSections.instruction: Did the health provider do the following?

subSections.title: D.8 Slide Cleaning and Slide/Microscope Storage

inputRows.label: Slides placed on kitchen paper to remove oil
Positive and negative slides stored separately in slide boxes to allow selection of slides for cross-checking.
Slide Cleaning & Microscope storage observation sub score
SUB-SCORE: D.8 Slide Cleaning & Microscope storage

subSections.instruction: Did the health provider do the following?

sections.title: SECTION E. Quality Assurance & Quality Control

inputRows.label: Does the facility receive prepared and stained blood smears? (If no complete the rest of the section by answering No)
Has the facility received any blood slides panel for EQA in the last six months? Verify
Did the facility examine the PT slides?
Are results of the PT entered in the log book? Verify
Does the facility retain a copy/record of results? Verify
Does the facility review results from the PT provider? Verify
Are results in agreement with verifier? Verify
Does the verifier record results in log sheet? Verify
Does the verifier provide coaching? Verify
Does the facility do corrective actions in case of result discrepancy? Verify

subSections.title: E.2 PT slide reading
subSections.instruction: Instruction: For this section, Supervisor select 10 PT slides, 4 slides for Detection, 3 slides for Speciation and 3 slides for Quantification. These should come from ZAMEP SLIDE BANK reference Laboratory during day of visit. Identify PT slides by writing the slide number and reexamine them using the set of saved PT slides. Let the available Lab Technician examine all 10 PT slides. Compare your results from slide bank answer sheet with those Technician and fill the PT assessment form below.   Note: On agreement column fill the total score agreement of slide read on detection, Speciation and Quantification.     Instruction: Fill the assessment after PT slide reading

inputRows.label: Does the facility perform IQC malaria blood slides daily?
Are the results reported in a log sheet by two readers daily?
Are 10% of the slides picked randomly, cross-checked by three readers and reported in log sheet daily? Select N/A if at least two readers not available
If there are less than two laboratory staff, is repeatability done? Verify. Select N/A if at least two readers are available.

subSections.title: F.1. Laboratory Malaria Register Data Consistency Check
subSections.instruction: Choose the most previous three month data from Malaria register and National malaria case register for positive cases. Laboratory Register, NMCR and write the values in each of the blank squares. Compare the values A and B as directed in the table below. Give 2 point for each of the matching numbers

subSections.title: F.2 Slide data collection

inputRows.label: Total number of slides examined in the last month
Total number of slides examined in the last month
Total number of slides for under five years examined
Number of slides positive for under five years
Number of Positive slides sent for quality control
Number of Negative slides sent for quality control

subSections.instruction: Fill the monthly summary report from the lab register to the data collection form.

Instructions: Collect 10% of negative and 100% of positive slides regarding as a first reader and send to re- examine at the ZAMEP reference laboratory for cross check at the end supervisor compare the result of first reader and second reader to provide score
